summary: The User Interface Designer and the Industrial Designer presented two prototypes, one with an LCD screen and one without. They demonstrated how to navigate through the menus and presented the voice recognition and energy source components and the charging stand. They discussed their modular design. They discussed the parental control module and the titanium casing. The production costs were below budget for the basic models. The Marketing Expert presented three important user requirements, and also the fruit and vegetable and spongy material trends in fashion. He then led an evaluation of the prototypes according to these requirements. The group did not feel that the remotes sufficiently met the criteria. They decided to continue working on the design and to take out the LCD screen and voice recognition. They discussed the modular design and its advantages in attracting customers. The group discussed how to incorporate the fashion trends; it was suggested that one shape was used, which could be customized with skins. The Project Manager led an evaluation of the group's experience on the project. The group was pleased with the teamwork and leadership, but one participant complained that not enough information was given about each meeting's agenda.
actions: The User Interface Designer and the Industrial Designer will look into options for spongy skin materials.
decisions: The remote will feature rechargeable double-A batteries and a charging stand. The remote can be customized for adults, children, or the elderly. The remote has a misplacement reminder that sends a message to the television screen to remind users to put the remote back in the charger when not in use. The remote features a modular design that allows users to add as many or as few components as they wish to the basic model. The group was unsatisfied with the design and decided to continue working on it, focusing on a fancier design. The remote will not feature an LCD screen or voice recognition. The group decided that the teamwork and leadership of the project were good, but that not enough information was given about each meeting's agenda.
problems: The group had difficulty deciding what would be displayed on the LCD screen. The group felt that too much focus was placed on the functionality of the remote such that they could not achieve a fancy look. The group did not feel that the prototype met the user requirements presented by the Marketing Expert. The group could not decide how to incorporate the fashion trends into the design. Not enough information was given about the agenda of each meeting.

Presented by: Norman Poh
User Interface Designer
1: Method

User interface - The aspects of a computer system or program which can be seen (or heard or otherwise perceived ) by the human user , and the commands and mechanisms the user uses to control its operation and input data . 
A graphical user interface emphasizes the use of pictures for output and a pointing device such as a mouse for input and control whereas a command line interface requires the user to type textual commands and input at a keyboard and produces a single stream of text as output .
2: some examples of remote controls:
The interface exists of a clutter of button functions, colors, and forms. This inconsistent use of interface is confusing and doesn't improve the use of the product.
3: Control multiple devices and surf your favorite channels with your voice! Stores Up to 80 speech samples, Controls 4 Devices -TV, Cable/Satellite, VCR/DVD & Audio. Record your own verbal labels that is connected to a remote control function.
4: A spinning wheel with LC display:
5: A scroll button with integrated push button
6: TV remote control for special user

Program in only the channels you want your kids to watch - all others are automatically blocked!
Child Friendly design and ease-of-operation ensures kids will love using their own remote!
Program in up to 10, 4-Digit channels. Dedicated buttons make getting to channels easy.
Supports TV's, TV/VCR, Analog and Digital Cable, DirecTV, Dish, TiVo, ReplayTV and Ultimate TV.
Secured and hidden programming and battery covers protect your settings.
10:
Big buttons are convenient
Voice recognition helps
Push buttons, scroll buttons, spinning wheels as navigation tools
User-customizable (kids, old people, etc)
Simplicity is the key!

User Interface Designer
1: Technical Functions design:
what effect should the apparatus have ?
2: Function

The function of a remote control is basically to send messages to the television set. Example messages are: "switch on", "switch off", "switch to next channel", "switch to channel 9", "turn volume up", etc. The followings are two examples of a remote control interface through which the functions are fulfilled.
4: Too many buttons; complex user manual

Having the TV connected to the Internet to access XML plus some preprocessing
KIV: speech recognition

0:
Presented by: 
Maganti HariKrishna
Marketing Expert
1: Findings

Recent investigation of the remote control market shows the following. 
- The most important aspect for remote controls happens to be a fancy look-and-feel, instead of the current functional look-and-feel. This aspect is twice as important as the second aspect. 
- The second most important aspect is that a remote control should be technological innovative. In turn, this aspect is twice as important as the next aspect. 
- The third most important aspect is that the remote control should be easy-to-use.
2: Recent Fashion Update

Fashion watchers in Paris and Milan have detected the following trends. 
- This year, fruit & vegetables will be the most important theme for cloths, shoes, and furniture.
- Also in contrast to last year, the feel of material is expected to be spongy.

0: Presented by: Maganti HariKrishna, Market Expert
1: Method

Find most interesting features the users would like to have.
Get feedback from the users by providing feedback forms in magazines, journals, etc.
2: Findings

Speech Interface adds up the value
Slim design 
Less expensive
Teletext for various languages
3:
Speech interface
Teletext option
Lighting Adaptive option
Task Remainder display option

0: Presented by: Maganti Hari Krishna ,Marketing Expert
1: Method

Responses from the questionnaires
Prizes for the most creative suggestions
2: Findings

75% of users find most remote controls ugly 
80% of users would spend more money when a remote control would look fancy 
Current remote controls do not match well the operating behavior of the user 
75% of users said they zap a lot 
50% of users say they only use 10% of the buttons
3:
Remote controls are often lost somewhere in the room (50%) 
It takes too much time to learn how to use a new remote control (34%)
4:
LCD on remote controls
Speech Recognition 
Button on charger to find the remote control (or Voice command)
Fancy look

SUMMARY – MEETING #2





[ABSTRACT] 

The project manager told us about the new project requirements. We discussed implementation points in more details (both for industrial design and user interface). I presented the very first components block-diagram.



[DECISIONS]

Decision has been made to go on with the technical staff proposals. Thanks to the marketing expert, we decided to embed a speech recognition system into the remote control (value-added feature), in order to “jump” directly to the desired channel.



[PROBLEMS/ISSUES]

How to get and process the information coming from the TV set, so as to address the content-based navigation problem. Find the cheapest hardware possible. 



[ACTIONS]

I am supposed to carry on with the components concept.

SUMMARY – MEETING #1





[ABSTRACT] 

As the industrial design responsible, I will be in charge of the technical aspects of the new remote control for television. The remote control system should be original, trendy and easy-to-use. Very first ideas have been proposed on the functionalities for our new product.



[DECISIONS]

The main decision is that each individual involved in the project should gather information about its own subject of expertise on how to effectively build the new product.



[PROBLEMS/ISSUES]

We mainly discussed about how to actually control the TV-set. Since we want to develop a remote control capable of dealing with content, the main problem will be to gather information about the program content, and how to process it.



[ACTIONS]  

Each individual is responsible to think about its own subject of expertise until the next meeting.

SUMMARY – MEETING #2





[ABSTRACT] 

The project manager told us about the new project requirements. We discussed implementation points in more details (both for industrial design and user interface). I presented the very first components block-diagram.



[DECISIONS]

Decision has been made to go on with the technical staff proposals. Thanks to the marketing expert, we decided to embed a speech recognition system into the remote control (value-added feature), in order to “jump” directly to the desired channel.



[PROBLEMS/ISSUES]

How to get and process the information coming from the TV set, so as to address the content-based navigation problem. Find the cheapest hardware possible. 



[ACTIONS]

I am supposed to carry on with the components concept.

SUMMARY – MEETING #3





[ABSTRACT] 

As the industrial designer, I was in charge to present the different possibilities to effectively realize the remote control. The user interface designer also shows what was possible to do, and the marketing expert reported us the market trend and the customer’s expectations.



[DECISIONS]

Decision has been made to quantify (money) the integration of speech recognizer and LCD display.  



[PROBLEMS / ISSUE]

Build one – or more – prototypes.



[ACTIONS]

build prototypes.

SUMMARY – MEETING #3





[ABSTRACT] 

As the industrial designer, I was in charge to present the different possibilities to effectively realize the remote control. The user interface designer also shows what was possible to do, and the marketing expert reported us the market trend and the customer’s expectations.



[DECISIONS]

Decision has been made to quantify (money) the integration of speech recognizer and LCD display.  



[PROBLEMS / ISSUE]

Build one – or more – prototypes.



[ACTIONS]

build prototypes.

SUMMARY – MEETING #4





[ABSTRACT] 

We present our beautiful prototypes…and discuss the cost, as well as the marketing issues. We rated our prototypes using the market expert criterion.



[DECISIONS]

Decision has been made to produce fruit-shaped remote control, with spongy feeling, and not much technology inside (cheaper). Decision has been based upon a recent market study presented by the market expert.



[PROBLEMS / ISSUE]

How to produce the spongy effect, which fruit shape to use ? Are the speech recognizer and the LCD display very useful (compared to production costs) 



[ACTIONS]

Find the best tradeoff between the shape / technology and the production complexity.

Dear Colleague,

Please keep in mind that your notes are part of the project documentation – among other things, they will be used by myself and other staff to stay informed about the state of the project. It is therefore essential that your notes – though kept short - are of high quality. In particular:

 

Do not use any abbreviations. 

Write notes that are understandable for somebody who was not present during the meeting 

 

The head of your department

		 

 

[ABSTRACT]   Besides taking my role as a user-interface designer, I am also concerned with the overall product design. The last meeting was more concerned with the functional design aspect. It was concluded that a TV remote-controller should give the user the flexibility to choose either by content or by channel. The conventional TV remote-controller gives only the option by channel and not by content. Hence, our new design is revolutionary in that it can give the user to option of choosing by channel. This poses a great challenge: how to implement that? One option is by retrieving XML files from a TV program website provider.





 

	 

	[DECISIONS]   

	There should be buttons to choose by contents or by channels

The head of your department

		 

 

 [ABSTRACT]   

We presented our prototypes. There are two versions: with and without LCD. Both comes with:

charger

Detachable (add-on) parental control module

Detachable big buttons (for old people)



Other important features are:

Detachable (add-on) speech recognizer

Security feature (robust to mishandlings; for kids)

Endurable battery life (high autonomy)

Robust-to-misplacement reminder

User-programmable channels and vocabulary

Pre-filtering of TV programs by genre

Cheap-to-produce and –manufacture materials

Light-weight

Fancy design and colors





 The prototypes were evaluated according to 3 criteria, namely fancy look-and-feel technological innovative and ease-to-use. We scored high on all 3 criteria. 

	 

	[DECISIONS]   

We decided not to produce the LCD version because the display can be transferred to the TV screen; this gives more space and fanciful display than the LCD.



We also decided that different kinds of “skin” can be used on the new prototype. In particular, fruits and vegetable skins are fashionable, according to the marketing manager.
